rules.natural: If the employee is late, then the employee is absent.
Either the employee is late or the employee is sick.
In the event that the employee is sick, the employee is not fired.
Should the employee be absent, then the employee is not fired.
If the employee is remote, then the employee is not present.
The employee is remote or the employee is on vacation.
Provided that the employee is on vacation, the employee is on leave.
If the employee is available, then the employee is not assigned to a project.
In the event that the employee is efficient, the employee is not terminated.
If the employee has taken a course, then either the employee is certified or, provided that management does not approve the employee, the employee is trained.
The employee has taken a course or the employee has attended a workshop.
Should the employee have attended a workshop, then either the employee is certified or, if management does not approve the employee, the employee is trained.
If the employee is skilled, then the employee is qualified.
In the event that the employee is experienced, the project is completed.
Should the employee be qualified, then the employee is experienced.
Either the employee has attended a meeting or the employee is not distracted.
Provided that the employee is prepared, then the employee has not attended a meeting.
If the employee has reviewed materials, then the employee is prepared.
Whenever the employee has studied, the employee is prepared.
In the event that the employee has researched, the employee has reviewed materials.
The employee has researched or the employee has practiced.
Should the employee have practiced, then the employee has studied.
If the employee is eligible, then, provided that management does not approve the employee, the employee is promoted.
Whenever the employee meets requirements, the employee is eligible.
Provided that the employee is qualified for promotion, then the employee meets requirements.
In the event that the employee has resigned, the employee has left the company.
Either the employee has resigned or the employee has retired.
Provided that the employee has retired, the employee is not replaced.
If the employee has left the company, then the employee is not replaced.
Whenever the employee is competent, the employee is trained.
Either the employee is a certified professional or, if management does not approve the employee, then the employee is competent.
In the event that the employee is uncertified, the employee is not a certified professional.
Should the employee be focused, then the employee is not distracted.
Provided that the employee is motivated, the employee is not distracted.
If the employee is productive, then either the employee is focused or the employee is motivated.
If it is not the case that the employee being deserving implies the employee is promoted, then the employee is fired.
Should it not be the case that the employee being on vacation implies the employee is not present, then the employee is terminated.
In the event that it is not the case that the employee being on leave implies the employee is not present, then the employee is replaced.
Provided that it is not the case that the employee not being available implies the project is completed, then the project deadline is met.
If it is not the case that the employee not being available implies the project is completed, then the project deadline is not met.
Whenever it is not the case that management not approving the employee implies the employee is not working, then the employee is distracted.
In the event that the employee is not available, the employee is skilled.
Provided that management does not approve the employee, the employee is assigned to a project.
Whenever management does not approve the employee, the employee is deserving.
In the event that management does not approve the employee, the employee is present.
If management does not approve the employee, then the employee is working.
Whenever management does not approve the employee, the employee is not trained.

facts.natural: The employee is qualified for promotion.
